info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 18 at 3:50AM CDT until August 23 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 108 possible. * WHERE...Furnas County. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will soar above 100 degrees Saturday afternoon and heat index values will climb to near 108 degrees in spots. While Saturday is expected to be the hottest day of the stretch, continued afternoon temperatures at or over 100 degrees through next Wednesday will result in a prolonged stretch of dangerously hot weather across Furnas County in Nebraska.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
